ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I became confident speaking in Spanish and also writing in Spanish.

I learned more about Spanish culture while improving my grammar skills through reading, writing, speaking, and listening.  I plan to continue my Spanish language studies, and this was a necessary step for me on my journey toward fluency.
further knowledge of spanish grammar
I improved my Spanish skills as well as cultural awareness.
I learned to speak, read, and write Spanish at a higher level. I was able to be immersed into Spanish culture through literature.
-improved Spanish grammar and vocabulary, as well as confidence speaking
Increased understanding of intermediate Spanish speaking and writing.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The strengths are the seminar format and the amount of time we have in the class. The class could benefit from more organization and more live instruction rather than reviewing what we read in the textbook the night before.

Strengths - engaging, reasonable amount of work expected, well-structured
Weaknesses - not always Zoom compatible, clearly a disparity in the level of preparedness of each student
very little speaking component and my fluency skills therefore decreased considerably. difficult to participate even when i wanted to.
The assignments on Canvas were not well indicated at first but later I got used to the pace and did not have any problem.

Strengths: Great teacher, useful skill
Weaknesses: Very difficult for a required class, online learning format is not great for spanish

-Could be improved with more opportunities for feedback; i.e. there was no formal and very little informal information on how spoken Spanish was until our oral exams the last day of class. Additionally, there was no pronunciation support other than optional sessions that were not recorded. 
-The course materials could also be better organized. It was many times difficult to find information and unclear what was expected in terms of turning in vs. not turning in assignments, materials not matching syllabus, etc.
This course was very engaging and introduced many different aspects of Hispanic culture in order to facilitate language learning.

Strengths were that it included a variety of material not just from the textbook (like movies, articles, and a book). Weakness was that it often felt monotonous and as a result boring. Maybe require more student presentations to keep us engaged.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I think Professor Reymundi did the best she could to make the class function on Zoom given the circumstances.
breakout rooms were good, most of the full class parts could be improved
The amount of interaction at class was very great considering learning remotely during the COVID-19 pandemic.
The zoom format succeeded for the most part in terms of studying and learning the language. It just wasnt as engaging as in person.

-the weekly Spanish tables, office hours, and similar virtual support were helpful, but I wish there had been some variation in timing. My classes were at the same time as many of these events each week and I unfortunately was able to make them
Every other day zoom meeting was a plus since zoom was quite taxing. Requiring more in person meetings for homework with classmates would have made things better.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: If you want to learn Spanish and be doing work for Spanish every day then this would be a great course to improve your skills.
I would recommend this course to another student if you need to fulfill a language requirement or want to pursue a language certificate.  Otherwise, I would not recommend this course.
not as much as in person spanish
Yes, I really enjoyed the course and would recommend it to another student.
I would only recommend this course if a student was really invested in learning Spanish. This class is at a high level.
yes - if you're interested in Spanish, but you need to be self-motivated as there are definitely aspects that could be organized better

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: We were asynchronous for two days, and synchronous for the other three. I liked this format as it gave us a chance to catch up on work during the asynchronous days.
There were also recorded lectures, Spanish literature and movies for learning.
Zoom Online learning.
also included recorded lecture and live virtual lecture
Outside of class videos and other virtual homework assignments.
